src:
Cubana de 78 años apodada "El huracán del Caribe" revoluciona Got Talent España y enamora al jurado con su actuación
06 Nov 2019, 17:45 by Yare Grau
El nombre de Cuba se volvió a mencionar en el programa español de cazatalentos Got Talent. Esta vez fue gracias a la presencia en el show televisivo de una cubana de 78 años llamada Moraima Olmera, conocida como "El hucarán del Caribe".
"Empecé en el Teatro Musical de La Habana, soy humorista, actriz, fui bailarina, soy cantante y escritora", se definió la señora, además de santera y "superviviente de tres guerras, un montón de tiroteos y no sé cuántos fuegos".



Una vez en el escenario, la cubana revolucionó con su simpatía y desparpajo tanto al público presente como a los miembros del jurado compuesto por Dani Martínez, Edurne, Paz Padilla y Risto Mejide. Incluso, se atrevió a vacilar a Mejide, diciéndole que vocalizara y que se quitase las gafas para verle los ojos.



Cuando Mejide le preguntó que le hiciese un resumen de su trayectoria musical Moraima le dijo: "No te oigo, vocaliza". Después continuó: "Oye, quiero ver tus ojos, quítate las gafas", a lo que éste contestó: "solo los ve mi esposa".
La cubana no dudó en compararse con su ciudad de origen y soltó un simpático: "Estoy como la Habana vieja, apuntalada pero en pie". 



Con su actuación, Moraima logró conquistar a los cuatro miembros del jurado, quienes le regalaron un sí para su pase a la próxima fase del programa.
text:
78-year-old Cuban nicknamed "The Hurricane of the Caribbean" revolutionizes Got Talent Spain and falls in love with the jury with her performance
06 Nov 2019, 17:45 by Yare Grau
The name of Cuba was mentioned again in the Spanish talent scout program Got Talent. This time it was thanks to the presence in the television show of a 78-year-old Cuban named Moraima Olmera, known as "El hucarán del Caribe".
"I started at the Musical Theater in Havana, I am a humorist, an actress, I was a dancer, I am a singer and a writer," said the lady, as well as a santera and "survivor of three wars, a lot of shootings and I don't know how many fires."



Once on stage, the Cuban revolutionized with her sympathy and self-confidence both the public present and the members of the jury composed of Dani Martínez, Edurne, Paz Padilla and Risto Mejide. He even dared to hesitate to Mejide, telling him to vocalize and take off his glasses to see his eyes.



When Mejide asked him to summarize his musical career, Moraima said: "I don't hear you, vocalize." Then he continued: "Hey, I want to see your eyes, take off your glasses," to which he replied: "Only my wife sees them."
The Cuban did not hesitate to compare herself to her hometown and released a nice: "I am like old Havana, propped up but standing."



With his performance, Moraima managed to conquer the four jurors, who gave him a yes for his move to the next phase of the program.
